subject: RE: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?
msgSnippet: I don t want to sound patronizing, but I have found that by using JUnit I rarely need to use a debugger. I suggest that you revisit your JUnit tests -- let the
messageBody:
I don't want to sound patronizing, but I have found that by using JUnit I
rarely need to use a debugger.
I suggest that you revisit your JUnit tests -- let the code tell you what is
wrong.

Failing that, I have had good luck with a product called BugSeeker by
Karmira
http://www.karmira.com/products/bugseeker2/

M. Erik Husby
